Dvffrnt.title: Dvffrnt
Dvffrnt.heading: Full Stack E-commerce Platform for Black-owned Businesses
Dvffrnt.description: Full-stack e-commerce platform for Black-owned clothing and self-care brands. Features AI-powered seller dashboard with natural language agents for inventory management, order tracking, and analytics.
bullets: Built with React Native for cross-platform mobile experience
Integrated AI-powered seller dashboard with LangChain and Qdrant
Implemented real-time inventory management and order tracking
Designed responsive web interface with modern UI/UX

Skoolio.title: Skoolio
Skoolio.heading: AI-powered Quiz Generation Platform for Educators and Students
Skoolio.description: AI-powered quiz generation platform for educators and students
bullets: Leveraged OpenAI API for intelligent quiz generation
Built responsive frontend with React and TypeScript
Implemented secure authentication and user management
Created intuitive interface for seamless quiz creation

Employd.title: Employd
Employd.heading: AI-Guided Resume Builder with Modern Templates
Employd.description: AI-powered resume builder with animated UI and professional templates for creating ATS-friendly resumes.
bullets: Built with Next.js 16 App Router and React 19
Integrated Supabase Auth for secure user authentication
Leveraged Anthropic LLM API to analyze user input and generate polished resume content
Implemented Framer Motion animations and responsive UI with Tailwind CSS
Developed FastAPI backend with SQLAlchemy for data persistence

event_billing.title: Event-Driven Usage & Billing Backend
event_billing.heading: Production-Style Metering and Billing System for AI Products
event_billing.description: Event-driven backend system designed to safely track AI usage, handle retries, and generate accurate billing. Built with a focus on durability, idempotency, and failure tolerance, similar to how real-world systems handle usage metering.
bullets: Designed an event-driven architecture that records immutable usage events instead of mutating state directly
Implemented idempotent event ingestion to safely handle client retries and at-least-once delivery
Separated fast ingestion from asynchronous processing using background workers and a message queue
Built durable event logs that enable replay, backfills, and full auditability of usage and billing
Handled failure scenarios with retries and dead-letter queues to prevent data loss or double counting
